item.title: Outcome of COP30 does not bode well for climate diplomacy. [ thedailystar ]
item.description: The 30th Conference of the Parties (COP30) to the UN Framework Convention on Climate Change (UNFCCC) produced a lacklustre outcome by any measure, as reflected in many post-COP analyses. This remains significant because COP outcomes continue to shape the direction, pace, and credibility of global climate diplomacy, even when they fall short.

How power and profit paralyse Dhaka’s transport system. [ thedailystar ]
item.description: Persistent traffic congestion, smog-choked air, and a fleet of poorly maintained buses define Dhaka's transport reality. These conditions are often described as a functional crisis. Yet, despite decades of sophisticated, internationally supported planning, efforts to modernise the city's transport system have faced continuous setbacks.

Bangladesh’s flag belongs on the world’s shipping lanes. [ thedailystar ]
item.description: Bangladesh is a maritime nation by location, heritage and workforce, yet its maritime policy remains anchored to a framework designed for another era. While nearly 90 percent of global trade moves by sea, Bangladesh continues to operate a closed ship registry that restricts foreign participation and limits the growth of national tonnage.
